fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30874].
  {panel}

I once had a JIRA Macro displaying all JIRA issues with a label "MYLABEL" (JQL: labels = "MYLABEL"). This returned seven results.

I raised another ticket, and applied the label "MYLABEL". This did not update the macro contents on view, but I believe that is expected.

I edited the page, and then the macro, and re-searched (the same search that was there). This second search returned eight results. I saved the macro and saved the page.

Upon viewing the page, the JIRA Macro still had seven results.
fields.summary: Re-searching the same JQL will not update the macro contents.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30871].
  {panel}

I'm asking to reconsider the following limitation:

bq. Default space templates differ from ordinary page templates in that they do not present the user with a form to complete, so variables should be limited to those listed above.

(Source - [Customising Default Space Content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Default+Space+Content?focusedCommentId=405046471#comment-405046471])

It feels like a pretty serious limitation to me. If custom fields can be prompted when creating a new page within a space, why can't there be custom fields when creating a new space? I'd argue that sometimes it's even more useful. Because every space is usually attached to a project, it makes sense to speed up project bootstrapping by providing coworkers with a form that requests things like:
* Project URL (e.g. test server, production server, etc.)
* Brief project description
* JIRA URL (though it's a shame I have to manually assign links between JIRA and Confluence every time, jumping between the two within the same project should be easier)

And use that information to generate a more useful space homepage. 
This would obviously be faster than first creating a homepage with default contents, hitting edit and inserting information into appropriate places inside the page (which can be long).

But besides speed considerations, it would also be a mechanism to *require* people fill out some minimal project information when starting. That is important too.
fields.summary: Support custom variables in the Default Space Content (homepage) template
Provide a way to disable the emoticons globally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30824].
  {panel}

Confluence does not implement HttpOnly Cookies setting programmatically and rely on Tomcat 6 capability to set it to true which is working fine for Confluence standalone version which comes with a pre-configured Tomcat.

However this is not the case for EAR/WAR installation and Confluence documentation does not provide a clear official recommendation in regards to enabling HttpOnly cookies as it is not [enable by default|https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=658267].

JIRA provide such documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Preventing+Security+Attacks#PreventingSecurityAttacks-httponly], however Confluence does not have such method documented officially.

*Possible Implementation*

This information should be provided on these two documentation from my point of view:

* [Best Practices for Configuring Confluence Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Best+Practices+for+Configuring+Confluence+Security]
* [Installing the Confluence EAR-WAR Edition|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Confluence+EAR-WAR+Edition]
fields.summary: Provide Official Documentation to Configure Tomcat to use HttpOnly Session ID Cookies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30822].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Disabling the Workbox plugins will leads to "No macro metadata" warning (screenshot) when trying to use the JIRA Issue Macro. You can also reproduce the problem if the In-app Notifications is disabled.
!no_metadata.png!

This is better explained in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/No+Macro+Metadata+When+Trying+To+Insert+JIRA+Issue+Macro

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Disable all three workbox plugins *OR* disable the In-app Notifications
# Create new page and try to use JIRA Issue macro - Warning on no macro metadata
# Enable back all three workbox plugins
# Create new page and try to use JIRA issue macro - Works properly

h3. Expectation

JIRA Issue Macro should continue to work properly even when the Workbox plugins are disabled. Other plugins should not interfere with another when it is disabled.

h3. Workaround

The workaround is to enable back all the Workbox plugins by sequence
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Common Plugin
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Host Plugin
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Confluence Provider Plugin
fields.summary: No Macro Metadata When Trying To Insert JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30812].
  {panel}

Currently, users can create a template to be used across Confluence to ease the creation process.  This allows for a number of pre-configuration but appears to be missing the ability to restrict the resultant page.  A great addition would be the ability to specify a set of permissions which are associated with a template.  Below is an example user story to clarify.

*Problem situation/ User story*
Bill is the finance guru at company X and needs to flesh out his quarterly report for which he uses a template.  This information needs to remain confidential to himself and the finance team until the end of the quarter.  However, there is no option to restrict the page prior to saving it when using a template which means that upon saving, anyone who is a watcher of the finance space will now that bill has started the report and potentially see what information is there if Bill forgets to add the additional restrictions.

What would alleviate the above would be either the ability to add restrictions when creating a page from a template.  Furthermore, the ability to specify that this finance template is restricted to Bill and the finance team by default ahead of time would ensure that Bill could not forget to restrict said page.
fields.summary: Ability to Specify Permissions For Pages via Templates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30780].
  {panel}

It's frustrating that the PDF Export feature offered in Confluence is basically broken for international users at the moment as the default fonts that are used do not have non-latin characters.

As a workaround, one can upload their own custom font that has the desired character set ([Creating PDF in Another Language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+PDF+in+Another+Language?src=search]), however:
* Only one font face is supported (see CONF-30779)
* Only one font style is supported (e.g. bold, italic, monospace, see CONF-10048)
* OnDemand users can't even do it themselves and need to ask support staff to upload the custom font for them
* In any way it's quite a bit of extra work to do

As you can see, even the currently known workarounds (which can be pretty time-consuming to execute) have serious limitations because, clearly, most technical documents make use of different font styles (including monospace for code inserts) and font faces (at least two typefaces are normally used in a document - one for headings and another for body text).

Then, even if embedding multiple fonts and font styles is supported, it's likely that the user would have to manually edit the PDF Stylesheet to configure different fonts/styles for different elements on the page (headings, body text, inline code, code blocks, quotes, etc.) to acually make efficient use of the new fonts and make the documents look decent.

Another concern with substituting fonts for PDF export and applying appropriate stylesheets to use them would be that the result PDF documents would very likely look different from their screen versions as the PDF stylesheet is of course used only for PDFs. Maybe it would be better to allow injecting fonts and custom stylesheets not just for export but for normal display of pages? But that's another topic.

To sum up, the functionality of embedding custom fonts and applying custom styles for PDF (and Word?) export feels like a hack and is not intended to be used extensively. Further developing that functionality without revisiting it completely looks like a road to nowhere to me.

*For now, please at least support international characters in PDF export out of the box!*

---
All the (possibly) related discussions I've found so far that may need to be updated/revisited/linked to this one:
* [CONF-26908: International characters in code macros dissapear after exporting page as PDF|CONF-26908]
* [CONF-28348: Administrators are unable to upload font files for PDF Export anymore|CONF-28348]
* [Atlassian Answers: International characters and PDF export|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/63504/international-characters-and-pdf-export]
* [Documentation: Creating PDF in Another Language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+PDF+in+Another+Language?src=search] (may need to be updated)
fields.summary: Natively support international characters in PDF Export

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Create+a+PDF+in+Another+Language

By default our PDF documents should be capable of handling these special characters.

Doing this appears to have caused the entire content of the page to be inserted at the top of the page, while leaving the previous content below - and slightly breaking it too (see the link in the third column of the 3-column section).

I've attached a couple of screenshots, but I'm also conveniently located on level 2 next to Benjamin Crothers - if you want any further information or a demo, feel free to come have a chat!

A huge advantage of Confluence + JIRA is the ability to isolate and decribe concrete issues out of the context (Confluence) and then deal with them in JIRA without having to do any manual opdate / synchronisation in Confluence and vice versa.

However, when moving a JIRA issue from one project to another, Confluence is not correctly updated.

1) Create issue using macro in Confluence.
2) Go to JIRA and move to another project
3) Note : link to Confluence in the JIRA issue is still correct
4) Go to Confluence and hit CTRL-F5
5) Issue now looses summary text and does not reflect the new issue number / summary text.
6) Note : Link in Confluence to JIRA works

Recently, lozenge macros (part of Adaptavist's Content Formatting plugin) pointing to URL's are broken.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Edit the macro and insert the URL of a page (e.g. https://<subdomain>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/PA/PA+Home)

h4. Actual results

!Screen Shot 2013-09-10 at 5.47.52 PM.png!
{noformat}
Unhandled element type '{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a'
{noformat}

Inserting the targeted page title (as opposed to its link) works.

The filter in the space directory is useful to reduce the long list of wikis. Given the following wiki names:
# "abcd efgh"
# "bcde"
# "x yz"

When entering a keyword the filter applies only when the text starts with the searchterm.
* Searching for "bc" only wiki 2 is shown.
* Searching for "ef" no wiki is shown.
* Searching for "*ef" an error is shown: "error applying filter".

I recommend two improvements:
* when the space directory is opened the filter field should be focused automatically so the user starts typing for filter without clicking (this is a standard behaviour in the link menu, create menu so why not here.
* no matter what I enter this string should be _anywhere_ inside wiki name, description or space category. when entering two strings with a space ("string1 string2") the space should be interpreted like a section of SELECT-Queries: show all entries containing string1 anywhere AND containing string2 anywhere.

Improvement 2 should be used in all search or filter menus - I found the filter for groups difficulties handling more than two asterix. This way the place of the string doesn't matter - names can be in any order.
fields.summary: Improve searching in the space directory to support substrings and/or wildcards

  {panel}

Currently,  user need to  create multiple template with the exact content with their own label in it. Then bind the create template macro to the newly created template. 

If the {{Create from template}} macro allow the user to specify the additional label in the parameter.
!dialog.png!
This will save the user for the need to create multiple template with the same content  which is extremely inefficient.
fields.summary: Create from template macro should allow user to add additional label
Support captions for videos

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30709].
  {panel}

h3. Symptom

Creating issues using JIRA issues macro in Confluence will set wrong security level (ignoring default option) set in issue security level scheme.

This only affects if the user creating the issue has the permission *Set Issue Security* permission in project's permission scheme. Without the permission, issues will be created with default issue security level.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an issue security level scheme with one of security levels is set to *Default* - associate it to target project.
# Ensure that the user used has the permission *Set Issue Security* in the relevant project's permission scheme.
# Go to Confluence and create a page.
# In the editor, use *JIRA Issue* macro and select to *Create New Issue*.
# Create issue and view it in JIRA.

h3. Actual Result

Issue created via the macro doesn't have issue security level set.

h3. Expected Result

Issue should be created with the default issue security level as set in its scheme.
fields.summary: Create Issue via JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence Sets Wrong Issue Security Level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30701].
  {panel}

Scenario:

We use Confluence as an internal Wiki for out development department. We have organised several spaces in Confluence. Each space belongs to particular topic like UI Development, CMS Development, Component Library, System Integration, .etc. 
 
Though, we need to classify all pages in all spaces against global categories (category is represented as list of attributes), for example: Skills = { .NET, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery}; Platform = { Linux, Windows, Android, iOS }; Programming Language = { C#, C++, VB }; .etc.
 
So we would like to have an ability to specify multiple category attributes for any page in any space. So, for example, the page could be associated with Skills = { CSS, jQuery}; Platform = { Windows }; Programming Language = { C#, VB };

It also needs to be user friendly so Confluence content editors could use specify each category attributes in the similar manner in which labels are currently specified in Confluence. Though, instead of adding attributes in bulk, to a single labels list, the attributes should be added to the corresponding category. 

In addition, all exiting categories attributes mus be available in all spaces and should be globally searchable.

It would be extremely handy  to have some features in Confluence to support this scenario. 

E.g.: if it would be JIRA we would just add new multi-select fields for each category, with a pre-defined number of attributes, which can be selected for this category
fields.summary: Page related global custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30698].
  {panel}

Customer would like the attachment search result to display the full breadcrumbs/path.

In 4.x, the result will output the breadcrumb in this order: Space > Page name > Attachments - simplified

Although the full path is: Space > Parent Page > Child Page > Child Child Page > Child Child Child Page > Child Child Child Child Page > Attachments

In 5.x, the result will output the breadcrumb like this: Space / … / Page name
fields.summary: Full path/breadcrumbs in attachment search result
labels in search result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30695].
  {panel}

It would be really nice to have the structural path or breadcrumb to the pages shown in the search result.
This is particularly an issue with spaces that are highly organised in structure.

Say I have page structure as:
- internal
- external

then when I search for a keyword, I cannot see in the search result whether the pages are in the internal or external section. I have to open each page to find out where the page is located.
This is very frustrating for our users.
fields.summary: breadcrumb / path in search result
Provide security restrictions/permissions for Templates and Blueprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30676].
  {panel}

If there are multiple pages with search results and you switch to the next or previous page.
Then the labels being searched for would keep being added on top every time.

1 Go to Browse > Labels
2 Click on a label (search result with multiple pages)
3 Label is visible on top of the page
4 Go to next page of search result 

> Label where you searched for is added 2 times!

*Additional information:*
Observation:
{panel}
In test environment, looking at http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing (space with key "BUG" and showing pages in it, that have "task-missing" label). Note URL of pagination:

* Page 1: current page
* Page 2: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&startIndex=10
* Page 3: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&startIndex=20

Note that in the URL the only thing that changes is "startIndex" parameter.

Now try go to that 2nd page and here is how url looks now:

* Page 1: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&ids=3768322&startIndex=0 (note that "startIndex=0" was added it shouldn't)
* Page 2: current
* Page 3: http://my.test.com/label/BUG/task-missing?ids=3768322&ids=3768322&startIndex=20

Note that "ids" parameter is now listed twice in the URL (with identical value).
{panel}
fields.summary: Paging in label browser keeps adding labels on top of the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30654].
  {panel}

Xref: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-75308

Section 10.4.2 of RFC 2616 provides that clients can infer that they've provided the *wrong credentials* when:

a) they get back a 'WWW-Authenticate' challenge for some scheme
b) they already provided credentials for that scheme in the request

However, the REST API currently thwarts this inference by responding with a challenge *only* for the 'OAuth' scheme, even though the request provided an 'Authorization' header for the 'Basic' scheme.  

The only valid inference the client can make is therefore "I'm using the wrong scheme", and not "I'm using the wrong credentials".

Which caused me a support call, and our mutual time, lately.
fields.summary: REST API 401 responses should challenge for Basic auth, especially when Basic credentials were supplied in the request.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30644].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The space owner, cannot manager users watching all blog posts in their space.

Space owner can only manage watchers of specific pages/blog posts in that space.

Many users only watch the blog for keeping up with the news in the space and not the actual content.

Example:
 We have a JIRA space in our Confluence instance. This space contains all system and operational documentation of our JIRA instance. Information not so interesting to the organization. However, the blog in the JIRA space is used for information about upgrades, new features, downtime etc. This is very interesting to the users. Therefore the users only watch the blog of the space and not the space itself. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability for the space owner to manage all blog watchers.
fields.summary: Add possibility to manage blog watchers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30639].
  {panel}

If a site has no application links, then the 'add-link' button in the space administration screens is not very telling of this fact.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have a confluence site with no application links established
# Enter any space and click 'space tools'->'integration'
# On the resultant screen, click 'add link'
# Observe that nothing happens aside from the button highlighting

There is a note explaining that an application link needs to be established BUT it could be clearer to have the button state this as well.  Perhaps when it is clicked there is one item in the drop down which says 'no application links are established' as opposed to doing nothing.  As of right now, for all the end user knows there could be a failure loading the list.

EDIT Another thought on this, if the user clicking the button is an administrator, perhaps the item in the list could be a link to the application links section of the administrative screens.
fields.summary: Improve messaging of space integrations page when no application links are established
